projectPurpose: To provide a robust, safe, and modular foundation in the Rust programming language for developers to build custom Wayland compositors by abstracting low-level details of OS and Wayland protocol interactions.
mainFeatures: Provides building blocks/libraries for creating Wayland compositors in Rust
Focuses on low-level helpers and abstractions for system and Wayland interactions
Handles input processing and graphics stack interaction
Aims for clear documentation, safety, and modularity
Includes a sample compositor ('anvil') for demonstration

alternatives.name: wlroots
mainFeatures: Modular and composable library for Wayland compositors
Abstracts display and input hardware (KMS/DRM, libinput, Wayland, X11 backends)
Implements many Wayland interfaces and extensions
Provides tools for common compositor tasks
Includes Xwayland abstraction for X11 compatibility

alternatives.name: libwayland (wayland-server)
mainFeatures: Reference implementation of the Wayland protocol
Handles communication between compositor and clients
Encodes and decodes Wayland messages
Provides a C API for compositor development

alternatives.name: Mir
mainFeatures: Libraries for creating Wayland-based shells and compositors
Designed for ease of building simple compositors
Supports various graphics stacks and Wayland protocols
Used in projects like Ubuntu Frame

alternatives.name: libweston
mainFeatures: Core library component of the Weston reference compositor
Provides fundamental compositor functionalities
Forms the basis for the Weston Wayland compositor

alternatives.name: Louvre
mainFeatures: C++ library for building Wayland compositors
Emphasizes ease of development and performance
Handles low-level tasks (Linux input/graphic APIs, buffers, protocols)
Provides default protocol management mechanisms

alternatives.name: Xlib
mainFeatures: Low-level C interface to the X Window System (X11)
Provides functions for window management and event handling
Includes graphics drawing primitives
Supports resource management and inter-client communication
Maintains network transparency

alternatives.name: XCB
mainFeatures: X protocol C-language Binding
Smaller footprint and improved threading compared to Xlib
Direct access to the X protocol
Extensible design

marketPositioning: Smithay is positioned as a developer-focused library within the Wayland ecosystem, specifically targeting developers who prefer building compositors using the Rust programming language. Its emphasis on Rust's safety features, modularity, and abstraction of low-level complexities differentiates it from C-based alternatives like wlroots and libweston, providing a safe and flexible foundation for creating custom Wayland experiences without the rigidity of a full framework.
